title: I received a summons from American Express Centurion Bank. How do I answer?
question: How do I answer their summons for my credit card debt? I called American Express to work out a plan and they said they sold the debt to a debt collection company. The American Express account number on the summons for my credit card debt only shows the last 6 digits and the rest are x'ed out. Are they supposed to show the entire account number? Am I really being sued by American Express or is this a debt collector pretending to be American Express?
answers:
Before you decide to file your own response in court to this lawsuit, please see the short video on the home page of my web site, which explains ALL options when summoned for a credit card debt collection lawsuit. It will make you better informed, on other options to consider.

If you decide to fight the debt collection lawsuit in Superior Court, please consider retaining an experienced collection defense attorney to represent you, so that you don't spend money filing the response, then end up with an even larger judgment against you. I have linked to my blog, below, one example of what happens when non-lawyers try DIY lawsuit defense against experienced, debt collection attorneys, who are in court every day.

Is this a lawsuit? Are you required to file papers with the court by a certain period of time? If so, you need to file a responsive pleading with the court within the time stated on the summons for the credit card debt.

No. The complaint does not usually contain an account number. If you read the complaint it should explain whether the suit was assigned to the plaintiff by American Express.

Before you answer, it's often helpful to think of what your possible defense would be? There are many possibilities, and no two jurisdictions are exactly the same.....but one might be the age of the debt?
